text: Thanks for the comment! I'll answer here in case anyone else is interested, We have sometimes referred to Bioconductor in the discussions, especially as <@U01JACR6L7L> is also involved there, but it is a separate project so I think it is out of scope for this reflection as we are focussed on the R Project. Similarly, rOpenSci is interesting to look at as a reference, but is completely independent. The R Consortium could be mentioned as the R Foundation is a member and the R Consortium does have a role in supporting the main R Project. However I'm not so familiar with the structures of the R Consortium and have left it a bit late to add it in for this coursework. Nonetheless, these are all organisations to bear in mind when thinking about potential reorganisations/improvements to governance of the R Foundation/R Project.
